description: Requests a description of one or more stacks. Required Permissions: To use this action, an IAM user must have a Show, Deploy, or Manage permissions level for the stack, or an attached policy that explicitly grants permissions. For more information about user permissions, see Managing User Permissions.

nested_items.name: Stacks
nested_items.description: An array of Stack objects that describe the stacks.

nested_items.name: StackId
nested_items.description: The stack ID.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The stack name. Stack names can be a maximum of 64 characters.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The stack's ARN.

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The stack Amazon Web Services Region, such as ap-northeast-2. For more information about Amazon Web Services Regions, see Regions and Endpoints.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The VPC ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.

nested_items.name: Attributes
nested_items.description: The stack's attributes.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ServiceRoleArn
nested_items.description: The stack Identity and Access Management (IAM) role.

nested_items.name: DefaultInstanceProfileArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of an IAM profile that is the default profile for all of the stack's EC2 instances. For more information about IAM ARNs, see Using Identifiers.

nested_items.name: DefaultOs
nested_items.description: The stack's default operating system.

nested_items.name: HostnameTheme
nested_items.description: The stack host name theme, with spaces replaced by underscores.

nested_items.name: DefaultAvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The stack's default Availability Zone. For more information, see Regions and Endpoints.

nested_items.name: DefaultSubnetId
nested_items.description: The default subnet ID; applicable only if the stack is running in a VPC.

nested_items.name: CustomJson
nested_items.description: A JSON object that contains user-defined attributes to be added to the stack configuration and deployment attributes. You can use custom JSON to override the corresponding default stack configuration attribute values or to pass data to recipes. The string should be in the following format:

nested_items.name: ConfigurationManager
nested_items.description: The configuration manager.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name. This parameter must be set to Chef.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The Chef version. This parameter must be set to 12, 11.10, or 11.4 for Linux stacks, and to 12.2 for Windows stacks. The default value for Linux stacks is 12.

nested_items.name: ChefConfiguration
nested_items.description: A ChefConfiguration object that specifies whether to enable Berkshelf and the Berkshelf version. For more information, see Create a New Stack.

nested_items.name: ManageBerkshelf
nested_items.description: Whether to enable Berkshelf.

nested_items.name: BerkshelfVersion
nested_items.description: The Berkshelf version.

nested_items.name: UseCustomCookbooks
nested_items.description: Whether the stack uses custom cookbooks.

nested_items.name: UseOpsworksSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: Whether the stack automatically associates the OpsWorks Stacks built-in security groups with the stack's layers.

nested_items.name: CustomCookbooksSource
nested_items.description: Contains the information required to retrieve an app or cookbook from a repository. For more information, see Adding Apps or Cookbooks and Recipes.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The repository type.

nested_items.name: Url
nested_items.description: The source URL. The following is an example of an Amazon S3 source URL: https://s3.amazonaws.com/opsworks-demo-bucket/opsworks_cookbook_demo.tar.gz.

nested_items.name: Username
nested_items.description: This parameter depends on the repository type.
For Amazon S3 bundles, set Username to the appropriate IAM access key ID.
For HTTP bundles, Git repositories, and Subversion repositories, set Username to the user name.

nested_items.name: Password
nested_items.description: When included in a request, the parameter depends on the repository type.
For Amazon S3 bundles, set Password to the appropriate IAM secret access key.
For HTTP bundles and Subversion repositories, set Password to the password.

nested_items.name: SshKey
nested_items.description: In requests, the repository's SSH key.

nested_items.name: Revision
nested_items.description: The application's version. OpsWorks Stacks enables you to easily deploy new versions of an application. One of the simplest approaches is to have branches or revisions in your repository that represent different versions that can potentially be deployed.

nested_items.name: DefaultSshKeyName
nested_items.description: A default Amazon EC2 key pair for the stack's instances. You can override this value when you create or update an instance.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The date when the stack was created.

nested_items.name: DefaultRootDeviceType
nested_items.description: The default root device type. This value is used by default for all instances in the stack, but you can override it when you create an instance. For more information, see Storage for the Root Device.

nested_items.name: AgentVersion
nested_items.description: The agent version. This parameter is set to LATEST for auto-update. or a version number for a fixed agent version.
